verse:
अणोरणीयान् महतो महीयानात्मा गुहायां निहितोऽस्य जन्तोः।
तमक्रतुः पश्यति वीतशोको धातुः प्रसादान्महिमानमीशम्‌॥

terms.आत्मा गुहायां निहितः (ātmā guhāyām nihit: Indwelling within the cave of the heart,
terms.तमक्रतुः पश्यति (tamakratuḥ paśyati): The perceiver of this subtle essence,

meaning: Meaning:The Self is smaller than the smallest and greater than the greatest. It dwells within the cave of the heart of every individual. The perceiver of this subtle essence (the Self) is free from sorrow. By purifying oneself, the individual can perceive the magnificence of the Supreme Lord.

upanishad-org.meaning: Finer than the fine, huger than the huge the self hides in the secret heart of the creature: when a man strips himself of will and is weaned from sorrow, then he beholds Him; purified from the mental elements he sees the greatness of the Self-being.
